statement:
Let $(\Omega,\mathcal{F},(\mathcal{F}_t)_{t\in\mathbb{R}_+},\mathbb{P})$
be a filtered probability space. Then, the space of semimartingales
$\mathcal{S}$ forms a topological vector space under the semimartingale
topology.

That is, semimartingale convergence is a and, for any sequence
$X^n\in\mathcal{S}$ such that $X^n-X^m\rightarrow 0$ as
$m,n\rightarrow\infty$ then there exists an $X\in\mathcal{S}$ with
$X^n\rightarrow X$.
